oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jesse West certificate for retiring a soldier
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Confederate States of America -- Army -- Tennessee Infantry Regiment, 28th; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; West, Jesse, 1844-1892; Confederate States of America -- Army -- Appointments and retirements; Invalid Corps (C.S.A.); Confederate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page document recording the retirement from military service of Jesse West of Smith County, Tennessee. The certificate provides West's rank, company, civilian occupation, and physical description. It is signed by three Confederate surgeons.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Adjutant and Inspector-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This particular discharge form was first used after the passage of the Act to Provide an Invalid Corps, approved February 17, 1861. Jesse West, age 21, was a farmer in Smith County before the war.
